Open the Windows operating system's Computer Management area.

299

# Configuring OS functions

# 10.9 User administration

Note

Only the groups in the "User Administration" Editor should be created for SIMATIC PCS 7 OS.

The names of the newly created user groups must be written in exactly the same way in the Windows operating system and the OS User Administrator. These names are case-sensitive.

Users are only created in the operating system of the logon computer. Once a user has successfully logged on via the logon computer, authorizations are then assigned to that user in the OS.

The following SIMATIC PCS 7 system components can also use SIMATIC Logon in addition to the SIMATIC PCS 7 OS:

- SIMATIC PCS 7 OS
- SIMATIC BATCH
- SIMATIC Route Control
- SIMATIC Manager
- Automation License Manager

# License

The license for SIMATIC Logon is integrated in PCS 7 in version V7.1 and above. A master license is automatically generated on the system when SIMATIC PCS 7 is installed using the general setup program.

Compendium Part A - Configuration Guidelines (V9.0)

Configuration Manual, 03/2018, A5E43228900-AA

# 10.10 Downloading the OS projects

# Requirement

The following requirements must be fulfilled in order to load OS projects:

- Required target path authorizations are set.
- The logged-on user must be a member of the Windows user group "SIMATIC HMI".

Note

You can find details regarding the requirements for downloading OS projects in the "Downloading and activating a project" section of the "SIMATIC PCS 7 Operator Station" (https://support.industry.siemens.com/cs/ww/en/view/109746516) manual.

# Procedure

By and large, individual OS projects, OS servers, and OS clients are downloaded in the same way. This is illustrated below, using SERVER1A as an example.

1. In the component view, select the OS object you want to download, then select the "PLC > Download" menu command.

NOTICE

In PCS 7 this is the only permissible method of downloading OS projects to the target computer. Using the WinCC Project Duplicator is expressly forbidden. You can find more details on configuring the Windows user authorizations in the "SIMATIC Process Control System PCS 7 – PC Configuration" (https://support.industry.siemens.com/cs/ww/en/view/109749317) manual.

Compendium Part A - Configuration Guidelines (V9.0)

Configuration Manual, 03/2018, A5E43228900-AA

# Configuring OS functions

# 10.10 Downloading the OS projects

In the next dialog you define the scope of the data which you wish to download. The first time an OS server (in this case, SERVER1A) is downloaded, a complete download is required. The procedure to follow for downloading changes for OS servers is described in this document, in section Downloading changes online (Page 305). OS clients always have to be downloaded in full.

Note

You can initiate compilation of the OS prior to the download procedure.

Compendium Part A - Configuration Guidelines (V9.0)

Configuration Manual, 03/2018, A5E43228900-AA

# Configuring OS functions

# 10.10 Downloading the OS projects

3. The dialog below shows how the download procedure is progressing; this procedure must be completed successfully.

Compendium Part A - Configuration Guidelines (V9.0)

Configuration Manual, 03/2018, A5E43228900-AA

303

# Configuring OS functions

# 10.10 Downloading the OS projects

You can call the load log for the server as well as for the client once the download procedure is complete. All the actions performed during the download procedure are recorded in this log, together with the time and date when they were executed. In the component view, select the OS, followed by the "Display load log..." menu command.

Note

The computer name in the WinCC project during configuration corresponds to the name of the engineering station for all OS projects. When the OS projects are downloaded to the individual PCs, the name is automatically replaced by that of the corresponding target OS computer (see load log).

Compendium Part A - Configuration Guidelines (V9.0)

Configuration Manual, 03/2018, A5E43228900-AA

# Changing projects in process mode

# 11.1 Downloading changes online

Introduction

Once you have inserted new plant objects/pictures and tested their function on the ES, you must update the relevant AS and OS servers to make the changes available to the operator. If no changes have been made to the structure and it is possible to only compile OS changes, the OS servers can remain in runtime mode during the download procedure.
Q: How do you create a user group called 'Operators' in the Windows operating system?
A1: Open the Windows operating system's Computer Management area and create a user group called 'Operators' in the Windows group management.
A2: To create a user group named 'Operators', navigate to Computer Management in Windows and use the group management feature to add the new group.
A3: In Windows, access Computer Management, then proceed to group management to establish a new user group titled 'Operators'.
A4: Creating the 'Operators' user group involves opening Computer Management in Windows and adding the group through the group management section.
A5: The process includes launching Computer Management on Windows, then creating the 'Operators' group within the group management interface.

NODE_TEXT:
Open the Windows operating system's Computer Management area.
4. Create a user group called "Operators" in the Windows group management.
5. Create a new user named "JohnGreen", for example, in Computer Management and assign this user to the "Operators" user group.

Q: What is the procedure for creating a new user named 'JohnGreen' and assigning them to the 'Operators' group in Windows?
A1: In Computer Management, create a new user named 'JohnGreen' and assign this user to the 'Operators' user group.
A2: To add 'JohnGreen' to the 'Operators' group, first create the user in Computer Management, then assign them to the group.
A3: Create 'JohnGreen' as a new user in Windows' Computer Management and ensure their membership in the 'Operators' group is set.
A4: After creating 'JohnGreen' in Computer Management, navigate to group management to include them in the 'Operators' group.
A5: The steps involve user creation in Computer Management followed by group assignment to place 'JohnGreen' in the 'Operators' group.

A2: For SIMATIC PCS 7 OS, create groups exclusively through the 'User Administration' Editor, ensuring exact name matches between Windows and OS User Administrator, noting case sensitivity.

A4: User groups for SIMATIC PCS 7 OS must be formed via the 'User Administration' Editor, with names identically and case-sensitively recorded in both Windows and the OS User Administrator.

Q: How are user authorizations assigned in the SIMATIC PCS 7 OS system?
A1: Users are created in the operating system of the logon computer, and upon successful logon, authorizations are assigned to them in the OS.
A2: After creation in the logon computer's OS, users receive their authorizations in the SIMATIC PCS 7 OS upon logging in successfully.
A3: Authorizations in SIMATIC PCS 7 OS are granted to users after they are created in the logon computer's OS and log on successfully.
A4: The process involves user creation in the logon computer's OS first, followed by authorization assignment in the OS after successful logon.
A5: Users must be established in the logon computer's operating system, with OS authorizations allocated post successful logon.

The computer name in the WinCC project during configuration corresponds to the name of the engineering station for all OS projects. When the OS projects are downloaded to the individual PCs, the name is automatically replaced by that of the corresponding target OS computer (see load log).

Compendium Part A - Configuration Guidelines (V9.0)

Configuration Manual, 03/2018, A5E43228900-AA

# Changing projects in process mode

# 11.1 Downloading changes online

Introduction

Once you have inserted new plant objects/pictures and tested their function on the ES, you must update the relevant AS and OS servers to make the changes available to the operator. If no changes have been made to the structure and it is possible to only compile OS changes, the OS servers can remain in runtime mode during the download procedure.
Q: What is the licensing requirement for SIMATIC Logon in PCS 7 version V7.1 and above?
A1: A master license for SIMATIC Logon is automatically generated on the system during SIMATIC PCS 7 installation via the general setup program.
A2: In PCS 7 V7.1 and later, installing SIMATIC PCS 7 with the general setup program automatically creates a SIMATIC Logon master license.
A3: The SIMATIC Logon license is integrated into PCS 7 from version V7.1 onwards, with setup automatically generating a master license.
A4: For versions V7.1 and above, the general setup program for SIMATIC PCS 7 installation includes automatic generation of a SIMATIC Logon master license.
A5: Installation of SIMATIC PCS 7 via the general setup program in version V7.1 or higher ensures automatic master license creation for SIMATIC Logon.

NODE_TEXT:
Open the Windows operating system's Computer Management area.
4. Create a user group called "Operators" in the Windows group management.
5. Create a new user named "JohnGreen", for example, in Computer Management and assign this user to the "Operators" user group.

Compendium Part A - Configuration Guidelines (V9.0)

Configuration Manual, 03/2018, A5E43228900-AA

299

# Configuring OS functions

# 10.9 User administration

Note

Only the groups in the "User Administration" Editor should be created for SIMATIC PCS 7 OS.

The names of the newly created user groups must be written in exactly the same way in the Windows operating system and the OS User Administrator. These names are case-sensitive.

Users are only created in the operating system of the logon computer. Once a user has successfully logged on via the logon computer, authorizations are then assigned to that user in the OS.

The following SIMATIC PCS 7 system components can also use SIMATIC Logon in addition to the SIMATIC PCS 7 OS:

- SIMATIC PCS 7 OS
- SIMATIC BATCH
- SIMATIC Route Control
- SIMATIC Manager
- Automation License Manager

# License

The license for SIMATIC Logon is integrated in PCS 7 in version V7.1 and above. A master license is automatically generated on the system when SIMATIC PCS 7 is installed using the general setup program.

Compendium Part A - Configuration Guidelines (V9.0)

Configuration Manual, 03/2018, A5E43228900-AA

# 10.10 Downloading the OS projects

# Requirement

The following requirements must be fulfilled in order to load OS projects:

- Required target path authorizations are set.
- The logged-on user must be a member of the Windows user group "SIMATIC HMI".

Note

You can find details regarding the requirements for downloading OS projects in the "Downloading and activating a project" section of the "SIMATIC PCS 7 Operator Station" (https://support.industry.siemens.com/cs/ww/en/view/109746516) manual.

# Procedure

By and large, individual OS projects, OS servers, and OS clients are downloaded in the same way. This is illustrated below, using SERVER1A as an example.

1. In the component view, select the OS object you want to download, then select the "PLC > Download" menu command.

NOTICE

In PCS 7 this is the only permissible method of downloading OS projects to the target computer. Using the WinCC Project Duplicator is expressly forbidden. You can find more details on configuring the Windows user authorizations in the "SIMATIC Process Control System PCS 7 – PC Configuration" (https://support.industry.siemens.com/cs/ww/en/view/109749317) manual.

Compendium Part A - Configuration Guidelines (V9.0)

Configuration Manual, 03/2018, A5E43228900-AA

# Configuring OS functions

# 10.10 Downloading the OS projects

In the next dialog you define the scope of the data which you wish to download. The first time an OS server (in this case, SERVER1A) is downloaded, a complete download is required. The procedure to follow for downloading changes for OS servers is described in this document, in section Downloading changes online (Page 305). OS clients always have to be downloaded in full.

Note

You can initiate compilation of the OS prior to the download procedure.

Compendium Part A - Configuration Guidelines (V9.0)

Configuration Manual, 03/2018, A5E43228900-AA

# Configuring OS functions

# 10.10 Downloading the OS projects

3. The dialog below shows how the download procedure is progressing; this procedure must be completed successfully.

In the component view, select the OS, followed by the "Display load log..." menu command.

Note

The computer name in the WinCC project during configuration corresponds to the name of the engineering station for all OS projects. When the OS projects are downloaded to the individual PCs, the name is automatically replaced by that of the corresponding target OS computer (see load log).

A1: The only allowed method is selecting the OS object in the component view and using the 'PLC > Download' menu command.
A2: In PCS 7, downloading OS projects must be done by choosing the OS object in component view and selecting 'PLC > Download'.

A1: A complete download is required the first time an OS server is downloaded.
A2: Initially downloading an OS server necessitates a full download process.
A3: For the first download of an OS server, executing a complete download is mandatory.
A4: The first download of an OS server must encompass all data, requiring a full download.
A5: A comprehensive download is essential during the initial download phase for an OS server.

# Changing projects in process mode

# 11.1 Downloading changes online

Introduction

Once you have inserted new plant objects/pictures and tested their function on the ES, you must update the relevant AS and OS servers to make the changes available to the operator. If no changes have been made to the structure and it is possible to only compile OS changes, the OS servers can remain in runtime mode during the download procedure.
Q: How can the load log for the server or client be accessed after the download procedure in SIMATIC PCS 7?
A1: Select the OS in the component view and choose the 'Display load log...' menu command to view the load log.
A2: To access the load log, highlight the OS in component view and select 'Display load log...' from the menu.
A3: The load log is available by selecting the OS in component view and clicking on 'Display load log...'.
A4: After downloading, view the load log by selecting the OS in component view and opting for 'Display load log...'.
A5: Inspect the load log post-download by choosing the OS in component view and the 'Display load log...' command.
